definition: (usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance

sentences.english: and jump in leaves,there is no harm.
sentences.chinese: 在树叶中跳跃，一点儿也不碍事。

sentences.english: Even the handicapped were not hampered from a roll on the dance floor.
sentences.chinese: 即使是残疾人也不碍事，他们也可以在舞场上转动。

sentences.english: It's okay. I'll go to Ross', get the blender.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的，不碍事，我去找罗斯拿果汁机。

sentences.english: So I left, so that I wouldn't be in the way.
sentences.chinese: 于是我离开了，我不愿成为碍事的第三者。

sentences.english: I never like that umbrella stand.
Great contingency design never gets in the way.
sentences.chinese: 好的权变设计永远不会碍事。

sentences.english: I began to feel unmistakably out of place in that pleasant family circle.
sentences.chinese: 我开始感到在这个愉快的一家人中间，我的确是碍事。

definition: to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
to be in the way/to be a hindrance
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
incorrect variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
variant of 囉嗦|啰嗦[luo1 suo5]
to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]
